title: Prompt Learning Design for Event Causality Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of introductory natural language processing (NLP) concepts and experience in social phenomenon analysis
context.additional_context: Program for pre-service/in-service teachers to strengthen causal analysis competencies within social studies curricula

learning_goals: Learners can identify causal relationships between events in text with 80% accuracy using pre-trained language models
Learners can design prompt templates to evaluate causality through "critical assumption verification" methods by applying the DAPrompt methodology
Learners can interpret prompt-based analysis results for real-world social phenomena (e.g., news articles) and apply them to educational contexts

resources: Access to Pre-Trained Language Model API

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
